Kiwanis Board of Directors March 8, 2024 Meeting Minutes

OFFICIAL MINUTES

The Board of Directors of the Kiwanis Club of Jefferson, Iowa met in regular session at the Greene County Medical Center Education Room on March 8, 2024. President Bill Monroe called the meeting to order at 7:00 AM. Board members in attendance were Bill Raney, Tim Buenz, Karen Shannon, Clancy Clawsen, Larry Teeples, Chad Stevens, Mike Palmer, Bill Steussy and Jim Teusch. Vern Foje was also present. Board members Hollie Roberts, Chad Butterfield, Sherry Palmer, and Denny Hammen were absent.

Kiwanis Weekly News 1/2/19

There were 18 members in attendance with two guests. Denny Goshon had family in town from MO and NE and brought them to the meeting. Welcome to all guests! Tom reported a can deposit of of $85.65. There will be an Aktion Club meeting next Monday.

Kiwanis Weekly News 1/2/19 Tim Buenz 2019-01-02 06:00:00Z 0

Kiwanis Weekly News 12/19/18

There were 25 members in attendance today. Vern reported a can deposit of $97.65. He also stated that the current Salvation Army Bell Ringing collection is around $6,000.00. Hollie reported that the Aktion Club had their Holiday Party last Sunday. They enjoyed soups and a gift exchange and had around 45 people in attendance. Secretary Toni read the December Board Minutes. The board of directors decided to cancel the club meeting on Dec. 26th due to the holidays. The club inducted new member Ian Wilkinson today, welcome Ian!

Kiwanis Weekly News 12/19/18 Tim Buenz 2018-12-19 06:00:00Z 0

Kiwanis Weekly News 11/28/18

There were 30 members in attendance today along with guest Les visiting from the Aktion Club and new member Ian Wilkinson. Several happy dollars were shared. Vern reported a can deposit of $102.60. The Aktion Club Holiday Party will be on Dec. 10th. Members shared thoughts and stories about the loss of our last remaining club charter member, Dean McAtee.

It was also announced that several donations were received. Laura Meyer sent us a check for$500 in memory of her husband and past member John Meyer. Todd Foje and siblings also made a donation of $500 in the name of long-time club member and volunteer Vern Foje (their dad). Kiwanis would like to thank these donors for their generosity and support of the club and our mission!

Kiwanis Weekly News 11/28/18 Tim Buenz 2018-11-29 06:00:00Z 0

Kiwanis Weekly News 10/24/18

There were xx members in attendance. Many happy dollars were shared by members. Vern reported a can drop deposit of $122.20. Good news was shared on the birth of Thomas & Susan Laehn's daughter. Tim Buenz shared the sad news of Kiwanian Floyd Hutzell's passing. Updates on the Silent Auction and annual breakfast were heard.

Kiwanis Weekly News 10/24/18 Tim Buenz 2018-10-24 05:00:00Z 0

Kiwanis Weekly News 10/03/18

Today's meeting was called to order by new Club President Tom Heater. There were 24 members attending today with Les visiting from the Aktion Club. Several happy dollars were shared and Vern reported a can deposit of $49.75. The total for the Kiwanis year that ended last week was $5,399. Thanks to Vern and all those who assist with the can depot! Hollie reported that the Aktion Club met last Monday and that they will have officer installation in two weeks. They are also planning an event to celebrate their 10 year anniversary which is on March 11, 2019. Vern updated members on a visit he had with Dean McAtee on the phone last night. There will be a board of directors meeting on Friday at 7:00 am.

Kiwanis Weekly News 10/03/18 Tim Buenz 2018-10-03 05:00:00Z 0

Kiwanis Weekly News 9/26/18

There were 23 members in attendance with two visitors. Vern reported a can deposit of $86.55 and mentioned that we are closing in on our goal of $5,000 as the Kiwanis year ends. Hollie reported that the Aktion Club held a memorial gathering for Tom Duncan at 209 Main in Paton. They have also set the date of Sunday, Oct. 28th for their annual Halloween Party.

Kiwanis Weekly News 9/26/18 Tim Buenz 2018-09-26 05:00:00Z 0

Kiwanis Weekly News 8/15/18

There were 22 members in attendance today with Les visiting from the Aktion Club. Vern reported a can deposit of $103.90. The total can income for the budgeted year is $4,400.00. The Aktion Club will have their last summer grill-out tonight with Bob & Rick cooking. They sold popcorn last Thursday at Hot August Night and accepted a check from the Greene County Motorcycle Charity for $1,250 which is the proceeds from their June event. The Aktion Club will meet Monday, August 20th. Reminder that Hazardous Waste Cleanup is this Saturday.

Kiwanis Weekly News 8/15/18 Tim Buenz 2018-08-15 05:00:00Z 0

Popcorn sales are going well at Farmer's Markets and they are excited for Hot August Night. Vern reported a can deposit of $310 for the last three weeks. President Lautner mentioned the upcoming August 10-11th NE-IA district convention.

Kiwanis Weekly News 7/11/18

There were 25 members in attendance today with Les visiting from the Aktion Club. Many happy dollars were shared by members. Vern reported a can drop deposit of $308.25 for the last two weeks. There were 22 members in attendance with Les visiting from the Aktion Club. Several Happy Dollars were shared and special occasions recognized. Vern reported a can deposit of $188.80 with the help of Dan and Jack collecting! The Aktion Club met last Monday and will be selling popcorn at the Bell Tower Festival and Farmer's Markets on Tuesday's. There were 25 members in attendance today with Les visiting from the Aktion Club. Dean McAtee was in attendance with grandson Cameron, a recent Michigan State graduate. Welcome back Dean! Special events and happy dollars were recognized. This was Dan Emmert's last meeting, we wish Dan the best in their move back to eastern Iowa! President Lautner reminded members of the Board Meeting on Friday at Uptown. A can deposit of $51.05 was shared by Sherry. The club will vote on new officers next week at the meeting.

Kiwanis Weekly News 5/23/18

There were 27 members in attendance today with Les visiting from the Aktion Club. Several Happy Dollars were shared and special occasions recognized. Vern reported a can deposit of $141.40. President Lautner shared information on grilling/serving food at the summer Farmer's Market on the square. The board will discuss this opportunity. Mike shared the slate of officer's running for the upcoming club election. Bob S.-Treasurer. Toni W.-Secretary, Directors: Kathy P., Lisa K., Denny G. and Vice President: Thomas L.

Dan B. reported on the HS Construction/Interior Design Open House. We grossed $367 from the food served during the event and will make a donation toward the local Skill USA program.

President Lautner called the meeting to order. There were 25 members in attendance. Many "Happy Dollars" were shared concerning the passing of the school district bond issue. Kiwanis Weekly News 3/21/18

President Lautner called the meeting to order. No guests in attendance. Happy Dollars were shared and special occasions acknowledged. Vern reported a can deposit of $66.00. Aktion Club met last Monday and has a calendar set for the year. They are getting ready for Relay for Life and helping with the Rec. Center Easter Egg Hunt on March 31st and smoking kits for Teen Maze. Teen Maze update from Pat. Cookies are due to the Rec. Center on Tuesday, April 3rd. Our students will attend on Wednesday morning, April 4th. Workers are still needed.

There were 30 members in attendance today. Two guests, Keri Saunders and Brandon Hommer also joined us this morning. Welcome to them! President-Elect Tom Heater called the meeting to order. Several Happy Dollars were shared and Vern reported a can drop deposit of $58.80. The Aktion Club met last Monday and is busy planning for Easter and Relay for Life. Toni read the board meeting minutes from the March 2nd meeting. The club Officer election will be held on Wednesday, March 9th.

President Palmer thanked our veterans in attendance for their service! Vern reported a can deposit of $82.70. A gift basket (donated by Jean Walker) raffle was held with Denny Hammen chosen as the lucky winner and $84 dollars was collected in the process!
